questions.question: The first Cricket World Cup was held in 1975 in England.
The inaugural World Cup featured 8 teams.
West Indies won the first two Cricket World Cups in 1975 and 1979.
The World Cup was initially played with 60 overs per side.
Kerry Packer's World Series Cricket influenced the creation of the World Cup.
The tournament was originally called the Prudential Cup after its sponsor.
Day-night matches were introduced in World Cup from the very first edition.
The World Cup format has remained unchanged since its inception.
The 1992 World Cup was the first to be held outside England.
Colored clothing was first used in World Cup cricket in 1992.
